{
  "article_text": [
    "according to results of danilov and jurkiewicz @xcite , the rational cohomology ring of a complete rationally - smooth toric variety is the quotient of a polynomial ring generated by prime invariant divisors by the stanley - reisner ideal .",
    "in addition to relations corresponding to linear equivalence of invariant divisors , there are higher degree relations corresponding to collections of divisors whose intersection is empty .    one can reformulate this presentation of the cohomology ring in terms of equivariant cohomology as follows . let @xmath5 be a complex reductive group acting on a smooth polarized projective variety @xmath6 .",
    "if the action on the semistable locus @xmath7 is locally free then the geometric invariant theory ( git ) quotient @xmath8 , by which we mean the stack - theoretic quotient of the semistable locus by the group action , is a smooth proper deligne - mumford stack with projective coarse moduli space .",
    "a result of kirwan @xcite says that the natural map @xmath9 is surjective . under suitable properness assumptions the same holds for quasi - projective @xmath6 .    in particular ,",
    "let @xmath5 be a torus acting on a finite - dimensional vector space @xmath6 with weights contained in an open half - space .",
    "the quotient @xmath10 is a smooth proper deligne - mumford toric stack as in borisov - chen - smith @xcite and any such toric stack with projective coarse moduli space arises in this way .",
    "the equivariant cohomology @xmath11 may be identified with the ring of polynomial functions on @xmath12 , each weight maps to a divisor class in @xmath13 under the kirwan map , and the stanley - reisner ideal @xmath14 is precisely the kernel of the kirwan map .",
    "for example , if @xmath15 acts by scalar multiplication on @xmath16 , then @xmath17 $ ] is a polynomial ring in a single generator @xmath18 , the git quotient is @xmath19 , the intersection of the @xmath20 prime invariant divisors is empty , and the stanley - reisner ideal is the ideal @xmath21 generated by @xmath22 .",
    "this gives the standard description of the cohomology ring of projective space @xmath23/ { \\langle}\\xi^k{\\rangle}.$ ]    in this paper we give a similar presentation of the quantum cohomology of compact toric orbifolds with projective coarse moduli spaces , via the quantum version of the kirwan map introduced in @xcite .",
    "the results here generalize those of batyrev @xcite , givental @xcite , iritani @xcite , and fukaya - oh - ohta - ono @xcite , who use results of mcduff - tolman @xcite .",
    "in particular , iritani @xcite computed the quantum cohomology of toric manifolds using localization arguments for toric varieties that appear as certain complete intersections , while fukaya et al @xcite gave a computation using open - closed gromov - witten invariants defined via kuranishi structures .",
    "the orbifold quantum cohomology of weighted projective spaces is computed in coates - lee - corti - tseng @xcite .",
    "the proof described here has several differences with the previous proofs , even in the case of fano toric manifolds : it does not use any open gromov - witten invariants , proves ( as the classical limit ) the danilov - jurkewicz description , and does not use localization for the residual torus action .",
    "a novel feature of the approach here is the appearance of minimal model programs , which are used to prove injectivity of the quantum kirwan map modulo the quantum stanley - reisner ideal .",
    "the critical values of the givental - hori - vafa potential acquire a natural geometric meaning in our approach : their logarithms are the transition times in the minimal model program .",
    "the dimension of the orbifold cohomology and the logarithm of the lowest eigenvalue of quantum multiplication by the first chern class decrease under each tmmp transition .",
    "we also obtain a more conceptual understanding of the appearance of open families of non - displaceable lagrangians in toric orbifolds , as a consequence of the existence of infinitely many minimal model programs .",
    "we introduce the following notations .    1 .   ( novikov coefficients ) let @xmath24 denote the",
    "_ universal novikov field _ of formal power series of @xmath25 with rational exponents @xmath26 we denote by @xmath27 the subfield with rational coefficients , and by @xmath28 the subring with only non - negative powers of @xmath25 .",
    "( equivariant quantum cohomology ) let @xmath29 denote the equivariant quantum cohomology of @xmath6 .",
    "we denote by @xmath30 the subspace with rational coefficients .",

    "explicitly the product @xmath35 is defined by @xmath36 } { { \\operatorname}{ev}}^ * ( \\alpha,\\ldots , \\alpha , \\beta , \\gamma ,   \\delta^{\\vee } ) \\end{gathered}\\ ] ] where the integral denotes push - forward to @xmath37 using the equivariant virtual fundamental class described in @xcite .",
    "3 .   ( inertia stacks )",
    "the _ inertia stack _ of @xmath10 is @xmath38 } x^{g,{{{\\operatorname}{ss } } } } / z_g \\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where in the first union , @xmath39 denotes representable morphisms from @xmath40 and the second union is over conjugacy classes @xmath41 $ ] of elements @xmath42 , with @xmath43 the centralizer of @xmath44 and @xmath45 the intersection of the semistable locus @xmath7 with the fixed point set @xmath46 the _ rigidified inertia stack _ is @xmath47 } x^{g,{{{\\operatorname}{ss } } } } / ( z_g/ { \\langle}g   { \\rangle } ) \\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where @xmath48 denotes the subgroup generated by @xmath44 , as in abramovich - graber - vistoli @xcite , chen - ruan @xcite .",
    "4 .   ( orbifold quantum cohomology of a git quotient )",
    "let @xmath49 denote the orbifold quantum cohomology of @xmath10 , or @xmath50 the version with rational coefficients .",
    "enumeration of twisted stable maps to @xmath10 ( representable maps from orbifold curves to @xmath10 ) defines a frobenius manifold structure on @xmath51 @xcite , @xcite given by a family of products @xmath52 defined in a formal neighborhood of an equivariant symplectic class @xmath53 by @xmath54 } { { \\operatorname}{ev}}^ * (   \\alpha,\\ldots,\\alpha,\\beta,\\gamma,\\delta^{\\vee } ) \\end{gathered}\\ ] ] for @xmath55 , extended by linearity over @xmath56 , and the pairing on the left - hand - side is a certain re - scaled poincar pairing on the inertia stack @xmath57 , see @xcite .",
    "[ qhex ] to connect with the notation in @xcite , @xcite ( where one works with different novikov fields ) we work out the following examples .    1",
    ".   ( stacky point ) let @xmath58 act on @xmath59 with weight two so that @xmath60 .",
    "the inertia stack is the union of two copies of @xmath61 corresponding to the elements @xmath62 of @xmath63 .",
    "thus @xmath64 the sum of two copies of @xmath65 , where @xmath66 is the additive generator of the twisted sector .",
    "representable morphisms from a stacky curve @xmath67 to @xmath60 correspond to double covers of the coarse moduli space @xmath67 , with ramification at the stacky points . since there is a unique double cover of the projective line with two ramification points ( up to isomorphism ) multiplication",
    "is given by @xmath68 2 .",
    "( teardrop orbifold ) [ teardrop ] suppose that @xmath69 acts on @xmath70 with weights @xmath71 .",
    "then @xmath72 is a weighted projective line , @xmath73 $ ] is a polynomial ring in a single generator , while @xmath74 where @xmath75 is the point class in @xmath76 and @xmath66 is the class of the fixed point set @xmath77 in the twisted sector .",
    "if we identify @xmath78 corresponding to the dual of the euler class of the representation with weight one then the fundamental class @xmath79 has image @xmath80 .",
    "the moduli space of twisted stable maps to @xmath81 of genus and class zero is then @xmath81 for no stacky points in the domain , or @xmath61 , for two stacky points in the domain .",
    "furthermore there is a unique ( up to isomorphism ) homology class @xmath80 twisted map with two smooth marked points and one stacky marked point with @xmath63 automorphism group .",
    "it follows that if we take the symplectic class @xmath82 to have area @xmath80 on the fundamental class then the quantum product is defined by @xmath83 thus after inverting @xmath84 , the orbifold quantum cohomology is generated by @xmath75 with the relation @xmath85 .",
    "( alternative power series rings ) some confusion may be caused by the multitude of formal power series rings that one can work over ; unfortunately almost every set of authors has a different convention .    1 .",
    "the equivariant quantum cohomology @xmath86 can be defined over the larger _ equivariant novikov field _",
    "@xmath87 consisting of infinite sums @xmath88 with @xmath89 , where @xmath90 is the delta function at @xmath91 .",
    "similarly , the quantum cohomology of the quotient @xmath51 can be defined over the novikov field @xmath92 consisting of infinite sums @xmath93 with @xmath94 , where @xmath90 is the delta function at @xmath95 .",
    "however , these more complicated novikov fields make some of our formulas a bit too long . 2 .",
    "@xmath86 is also defined over the _ universal novikov ring _",
    "@xmath96 , and if @xmath82 is integral , over @xmath97 $ ] .",
    "similarly , @xmath51 is defined over the novikov ring @xmath96 , and if @xmath82 is integral , over @xmath98 $ ] for @xmath99 equal to the least common multiple of the orders of the automorphism groups in @xmath10 .",
    "however , it is convenient to work over the field @xmath24 .",
    "invariance under hamiltonian perturbation only holds for floer / quantum cohomology over the novikov field @xmath24 , and so working over @xmath24 is more natural for the purposes of symplectic geometry .",
    "3 .   unfortunately ,",
    "@xmath24 and @xmath96 are non - noetherian over @xmath100 and so some care is required when talking about intersection multiplicities etc . in practice ,",
    "when we wish to talk about intersection multiplicities we assume that the symplectic form is integral in which case everything is defined over @xmath101 $ ] .",
    "4 .   in algebraic geometry",
    ", one often uses the monoid - algebra of effective curve classes , but we prefer novikov fields because of the better invariance properties .",
    "in fact , the cone of effective curve classes is not any more explicit than working over the novikov field since it is the classes of _ connected curves _ that appear in the gromov - witten potentials , and these are rather hard to determine .    in @xcite",
    "the second author studied the relationship between @xmath86 and @xmath51 given by virtual enumeration of affine gauged maps , called the _ quantum kirwan map_. an @xmath99-marked _ affine gauged map _ is a representable morphism from a weighted projective line @xmath102 for some @xmath103 to the quotient stack @xmath104 mapping @xmath105 to the semistable locus @xmath10 .",
    "more precisely , the domain of an affine gauged map is a curve with a single stacky point with automorphism group of order @xmath106 , which is not canonically identified with @xmath107 ; this distinction becomes important in the definition of families of affine gauged maps which we omit here .",
    "some of the results of @xcite are :    ( definition and properties of the quantum kirwan map )    1 .",
    "the stack @xmath108 of @xmath99-marked affine gauged maps of class @xmath109 has a natural compactification @xmath110 .",
    "we denote by @xmath111 the evaluation maps @xmath112 and @xmath113 their restrictions to maps of class @xmath114 .",
    "the moduli stack @xmath110 has a perfect relative obstruction theory over @xmath115 ( the case of @xmath6 and @xmath5 trivial ) where @xmath115 is the complexification of stasheff s multiplihedron .",
    "2 .   for any @xmath116 , the map defined by virtual enumeration of stable @xmath99-marked affine gauged maps @xmath117 is well - defined .",
    "3 .   the sum @xmath118 defines a formal map from @xmath32 to @xmath50 in a neighborhood of the symplectic class @xmath82 with the property that each linearization @xmath119 is a @xmath120-homomorphism with respect to the quantum products .    by analogy with the classical case one hopes to obtain a presentation of the quantum cohomology algebra @xmath121 by showing that @xmath122 is surjective and computing its kernel .",
    "this hope leads to the following strong and weak quantum version of kirwan surjectivity . in the strong form",
    ", one might hope that @xmath123 has infinite radius of convergence , @xmath123 is surjective , and @xmath122 is surjective for any @xmath124 .",
    "more modestly , one might hope that @xmath122 is surjective for @xmath33 in a formal neighborhood of a rational symplectic class @xmath34 .",
    "we now specialize to the toric case .",

    "the quotient @xmath146 is then a smooth ( possibly empty ) proper deligne - mumford stack .",
    "we suppose that @xmath10 is non - empty .",

    "( batyrev ring for projective space ) let @xmath151 act on @xmath16 by scalar multiplication so that all weights @xmath152 are equal to @xmath153 and the polarization vector @xmath154 . then there is a unique subset @xmath155 in @xmath156 and @xmath157 .",
    "thus the semistable locus is @xmath158 and the git quotient is @xmath159 .",

    "[ teardrop2 ] ( batyrev ring for the teardrop orbifold ) continuing example [ qhex ] , suppose that @xmath58 acts on @xmath70 with weights @xmath71 so that @xmath162 is a weighted projective line .",
    "the batyrev ring is @xmath161/ { \\langle}(\\xi)(2\\xi)^2 - q { \\rangle}$ ] .",
    "our main result says that batyrev s original suggestion @xcite for the quantum cohomology is true , after passing to a suitable formal version of the equivariant cohomology and `` quantizing '' the divisor classes :    [ main0 ] for a suitable formal version of the equivariant quantum cohomology @xmath86 ( see section [ formal ] ) the linearized quantum kirwan map @xmath122 induces an isomorphism @xmath163 for @xmath33 in a formal neighborhood of any rational symplectic class @xmath164 .    1 .   ( history )",
    "many earlier cases of this theorem were known .",
    "batyrev @xcite proved a similar presentation in the case of convex toric manifolds , that is , in the case that the deformations of any stable map are un - obstructed . in the semi - fano case ( that is",
    ", @xmath165 is non - negative on any curve class ) a presentation was given by givental @xcite .",
    "for non - weak - fano toric manifolds , iritani @xcite gave an isomorphism with the batyrev ring , see also brown @xcite .",
    "from the symplectic point of view a presentation for the quantum cohomology of toric manifolds was given in fukaya et al @xcite , using results of mcduff - tolman @xcite on the seidel representation .",
    "the latter approach uses open - closed gromov - witten invariants to define a potential counting holomorphic disks whose leading order terms are the potential above .",
    "the quantum stanley - reisner relations were proved for toric orbifolds in woodward @xcite , and , we understand , in unpublished work by chung - ciocan - fontanine - kim and coates , corti , iritani , and tseng . that these relations generate",
    "the ideal was expected for some time , see iritani @xcite .",
    "thus the main content of this paper is that these relations suffice .",
    "after the first version of this paper appeared , a quantization of the borisov - chen - smith presentation of the orbifold cohomology was given in tseng - wang @xcite .",
    "note that the latter is _ not _ a presentation in terms of divisor classes ; for example , for weighted projective spaces the typical number of generators is much larger than one , while the batyrev ring has a single generator .",
    "( necessity of the novikov field ) for the result above to hold the quantum cohomology must be defined over the novikov _ field _ , or at least , that a suitable rational power of the formal parameter @xmath25 has been inverted : over a polynomial ring such as @xmath166 $ ] , one does not obtain an surjection because certain elements in twisted sectors are not contained in the image for @xmath167 .",
    "thus one sees a batyrev presentation of the quantum cohomology only for non - zero @xmath25 .",
    "the necessity of corrections to batyrev s original conjecture , which involved the divisor classes as generators , was noted in cox - katz ( * ? ? ?",
    "* example 11.2.5.2 ) for the second hirzebruch surface and spielberg @xcite for a toric three - fold .",
    "the fact that the change of coordinates restores the original presentation was noted in guest @xcite for semi - fano toric varieties , and iritani ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 5 ) , for not - necessarily - fano toric varieties in general , after passing to a formal completion .",
    "see iritani ( * ? ? ?",
    "* example 5.5 ) and gonzalez - iritani ( * ? ? ?",
    "* example 3.5 ) for examples in the toric manifold case .",
    "( projectivity ? ) note that danilov s results @xcite do not require projectivity of the coarse moduli space .",
    "it seems possible that quantum cohomology might also be defined for non - projective toric varieties .",
    "namely certain convergence conditions would remove the necessity of working over a novikov ring , and one might have a theorem similar to [ main0 ] , but we lack any results in this direction .",
    "the presentation of the quantum cohomology in theorem [ main0 ] can be re - phrased in terms of landau - ginzburg potential as follows , according to suggestions of givental @xcite and the physicists related to mirror symmetry .",
    "this formulation will be essential in our proof of the injectivity of the map in theorem [ main0 ] .",
    "[ bigtorus ]    1 .",
    "( residual torus ) let @xmath168 denote the `` big torus '' acting on @xmath16 .",
    "the _ residual torus _",
    "@xmath169 has an induced action on @xmath170 .",
    "let @xmath171 denote the unitary part of @xmath172 @xmath173 given by exponentiating the real span @xmath174 of the coweights @xmath175 of @xmath172 .",
    "the lie algebra @xmath176 of @xmath172 admits a canonical real splitting @xmath177 a canonical parametrization of the residual torus can be found by row - reduction on the matrix of weights , see example [ potexamples ] below . 2 .",
    "( moment polytope ) the action of @xmath178 on @xmath10 is hamiltonian , with moment map @xmath179 induced by the choice of moment map for the action of @xmath180 on @xmath6 .",
    "let @xmath181 denote its image @xmath182 the _ moment polytope _ of @xmath10 .",
    "( facets and spurious inequalities ) let @xmath183 be the inward normal vectors to the facets of @xmath184 ; these are the images of the minus the standard basis vectors of @xmath185 under the projection @xmath186 to @xmath174 : @xmath187 the moment polytope @xmath184 is of the form @xmath188 with positions of the facets determined by elements @xmath189 .",
    "we say that @xmath190 is a _ spurious inequality _ if it does not correspond to a facet of @xmath184 .",
    "4 .   ( support constants )",
    "the _ support constants _ @xmath191 defining the positions of the facets of @xmath184 can be chosen as follows .",
    "given an extension of @xmath82 to @xmath192 , isomorphic to @xmath193 , the constants @xmath191 are the coefficients of @xmath82 .",
    "( tropical dual torus ) our landau - ginzburg potential has domain a certain formal version of the dual torus @xmath194 to @xmath172 . the _ tropical dual torus _ is @xmath195 where the sum over @xmath114 satisfies the same finiteness condition as in the definition of @xmath24 , namely for each @xmath196 the number of non - zero @xmath197 with @xmath198 is finite . here ,",
    "multiplication of elements with _ logarithmic coefficients _ @xmath199 and _ power series coefficients _ @xmath200 for @xmath201 is defined by addition of coefficients ; that is , the product of two elements so defined is @xmath202 alternatively , the tropical dual torus is the set of exponentiation of power series @xmath203 .",
    "that is , the tropical dual torus is obtained by exponentiating power series with a logarithmic term in the quantum variable ; we use the terminology _ tropical _ as a mellifluous synonym for _",
    "logarithmic_. 6 .",
    "( givental potential ) the naive landau - ginzburg potential associated to the toric stack @xmath10 is a function on the tropical dual torus given as a sum of monomials whose exponents are the normal vectors to the facets of @xmath204 .",
    "( the reader may wish to compare with the treatment in fukaya et al ( * ? ? ?",
    "* definition 2.1 ) , where the potential is an element of a completed power series ring in coordinates @xmath205 ) .",
    "it was first noticed by givental @xcite that this function is related to the gromov - witten theory of @xmath10 .",
    "an explanation from the point of view of mirror symmetry was given in hori - vafa @xcite , and a connection to floer theory is described in fukaya et al @xcite , where the potential appears as a count of holomorphic disks with boundary in a fiber of the moment map . in the later version ,",
    "the potential receives corrections from nodal holomorphic disks , whereas in givental @xcite and hori - vafa @xcite there are no corrections ; we call the uncorrected version the _ givental potential _ , given by @xmath206 or more precisely @xmath207    1 .",
    "( elimination of negative powers of @xmath25 ) as it stands , the values of @xmath208 have negative powers of @xmath25 .",
    "however , later we will always assume that @xmath209 is contained in the interior of the moment polytope @xmath184 , in which case only positive powers occur .",
    "( naive small potential versus corrected small potential ) for the many purposes ( non - displaceability , batyrev presentation ) it seems that the naive potential is `` as good as '' the corrected potential . a heuristic argument that the two potentials are related by a geometrically - defined change of coordinates",
    "was given in woodward @xcite ; for semi - fano cases it is proved in chan et al @xcite that this coordinate change is the mirror map from gromov - witten theory , while fukaya et al ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 11.1 ) show the existence of some coordinate transformation relating the two .",

    "the potential is @xmath219 2 .",

    "that is , may be removed without changing @xmath184 .",

    "that is , each component of @xmath230 becomes unramified over @xmath251 $ ] . by a simple case of the grothendieck existence theorem @xcite , any point of @xmath244",
    "is obtained by completion from a point of @xmath230 containing @xmath245 .    1 .   ( critical locus for a product of projective lines )",
    "continuing the example of a product of projective lines @xmath254 from example [ potexamples ] ( a ) , the critical locus is defined by @xmath255 @xmath256 which has solutions @xmath257 . under the map these map to @xmath258 , all of which approach @xmath259 as @xmath249 .",
    "( critical locus for a projective line with extra term ) continuing the example of the projective line @xmath10 with potential with extra term from example [ potexamples ] ( b ) @xmath260 for which the critical points are @xmath261 and @xmath262 . under the injection",
    "these map to @xmath263 which converges to @xmath209 as @xmath249 , and @xmath264 which does not converge to @xmath209 as @xmath249 .",
    "an interpretation in terms of critical points that lie over the interior of the moment polytope is given in proposition [ closure ] .",
    "a reformulation of our main result is in the case @xmath265 the symplectic class :    [ main ] for any rational symplectic class @xmath266 , there is a canonical isomorphism @xmath267    1 .",
    "the left - hand - side is independent of the presentation of @xmath10 as a git quotient of @xmath6 by @xmath5 , while the right - hand - side depends on the presentation . as we will see below ,",
    "the different presentations of @xmath10 can lead to different splittings of the quantum cohomology .",
    "2 .   that the rings on both sides have the same dimension follows in the fano case from kouchnirenko s theorem @xcite . in general",
    ", we deduce the dimension equality from the toric minimal model program and an induction .",
    "a similar procedure is used by kawamata @xcite to show the existence of an exceptional collection in the derived category of any toric orbifold .",
    "the frobenius manifold structure @xmath1 , including the pairing , is expected to be equivalent to saito s frobenius structure corresponding to the landau - ginzburg potential @xmath4 , see for example fukaya et al @xcite .",
    "however , we do not discuss the pairings in this paper .",
    "we give a family version of theorem [ main ] in theorem [ familymain ] below .",
    "we end the introduction with examples of the projective plane , written in different ways as a quotient :    1 .",
    "( projective plane as a quotient by a circle action ) the projective plane can be realized as a git quotient of affine space by a circle action as follows .",
    "suppose that @xmath58 acts on @xmath220 by scalar multiplication .",
    "suppose that the polarization corresponds to a trivial line bundle with a negative weight on the fiber at the origin .",
    "the semistable locus is @xmath268 and the git quotient is @xmath269 . we take the residual action of @xmath270 to have moment polytope in @xmath271 equal to @xmath272 the corresponding potential is @xmath273 the critical points are the solutions to @xmath274 @xmath275 that is , @xmath276 .",
    "these generators and relations give a presentation of the quantum cohomology of @xmath277 .",
    "( projective plane as a quotient by a two - torus action ) the projective plane @xmath277 can be realized as a git quotient by a two - dimensional torus as follows .",
    "suppose that @xmath221 acts on @xmath278 with weights @xmath279 .",

    "suppose that the polarization corresponds to the weight @xmath284 ; this is the right - most chamber in figure [ 3chambers ] .",

    "this ends the example .",
    "we thank d. cox , h. iritani , d. mcduff , and c. teleman for helpful comments .",
    "in this section we prove surjectivity for the linearization of the quantum kirwan map on a formal completion of equivariant quantum cohomology ; the surjectivity also holds for the uncompleted cohomology but does not lead to an isomorphism .",
    "let @xmath6 be a smooth polarized projective @xmath5-variety , or more generally , a quasiprojective smooth polarized projective @xmath5-variety convex at infinity in the sense of @xcite , such as a finite - dimensional vector space with the action of a torus whose weights are contained in a half - space .",
    "the version of quantum kirwan surjectivity we need involves a formal completion of the equivariant quantum cohomology , in which not only the powers of @xmath25 but also the degrees of the cohomology classes can go to infinity :    ( formal equivariant quantum cohomology ring ) [ completed ] let @xmath305 be the space of infinite sums @xmath306 equivalently , @xmath305 is obtained by completing @xmath307 with respect to the degree filtration on @xmath11 , and then inverting @xmath25 .",
    "( other completions ) note that there are various other natural completions .",
    "for example , completing @xmath308 with respect to the degree filtration on @xmath11 gives a space of formal sums whose @xmath25-degree is not necessarily bounded below .",
    "the quantum kirwan map does not extend to this formal completion . in the toric case",
    "the relationship between various completions is discussed by fukaya et al in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 12 ) .",
    "( extension of the quantum kirwan map to the formal equivariant quantum cohomology ) [ qkextends ] each taylor coefficient @xmath309 extends to a map @xmath310 , still denoted @xmath311 .",
    "the statement of the proposition follows from the properness result for the energy map : for any @xmath312 , the set of non - empty @xmath110 for which @xmath313 is finite ; in particular , for any energy bound @xmath314 , the virtual dimensions of the components @xmath110 of energy @xmath315 is bounded from above by some number @xmath316 .",
    "thus if @xmath317 satisfy @xmath318 then the push - forward of @xmath319 to @xmath320 is zero for reasons of dimension .",
    "if @xmath321 has degree bounded from below by @xmath322 then the contribution of @xmath323 contains only terms with @xmath25-degree at least @xmath314 .",
    "the claim follows .",
    "we now partially compute the quantum kirwan map in the toric case .",
    "let @xmath6 be a finite - dimensional complex vector space with an action of a complex torus @xmath5 , with weights contained in an open half - space and equipped with a polarization so that the quotient @xmath10 is locally free .",

    "one sees that @xmath333 is a vector bundle over @xmath338 of rank @xmath339 .    by definition ,",
    "a morphism @xmath340 consists of a @xmath5-bundle @xmath341 , given in terms of a clutching function @xmath342 for some @xmath343 with @xmath344 , and a section of the associated @xmath6-bundle @xmath345 .",
    "the first condition in the statement of the proposition is the condition that a map @xmath346 extend to a global section , while the second is the condition that the extension maps @xmath347 to the semistable locus @xmath10 .",
    "the representability condition is that the image of @xmath347 is a point @xmath348 in @xmath10 with automorphism group containing a group @xmath107 generated by @xmath349 , so that @xmath350 is the minimal representation of @xmath114 and each map",
    "@xmath351 above appears once in the classification .",
    "[ weaktoric2 ] ( quantum kirwan surjectivity , toric case ) for any rational symplectic class @xmath34 , the map @xmath352 is surjective .",
    "( the case of a free quotient ) if @xmath10 is a smooth _ variety _ , that is , has no orbifold points , then the statement of the theorem follows from kirwan s surjectivity result from @xcite , or an explicit description of the classical kirwan map in the toric case , since the leading order term ( setting the novikov parameter @xmath25 to zero ) is the classical kirwan map .",
    "the novelty of the above theorem is that in the orbifold case , the twisted sectors are also in the image of the quantum kirwan map , so that @xmath353 is a quotient of the usual ring of polynomial invariants @xmath354 .",
    "the proof of theorem [ weaktoric2 ] in general relies on the following computation which we call a _ fractional batyrev relation _ based on similarity with batyrev @xcite .    1 .",

    "@xmath358 is the smallest integer greater than or equal to @xmath357 .",

    "[ fractional batyrev relation ] [ fractional ] for any @xmath114 such that @xmath367 has non - empty fixed point set in @xmath7 and @xmath371 is non - empty , @xmath372    recall that @xmath373 is the stack of once - marked stable scaled affine gauged maps to @xmath6 @xcite .",
    "in general , this compactification allows bubbles in @xmath10 and ghost bubbles in @xmath6 when the points come together .",
    "however , since @xmath6 is affine , there are no non - constant holomorphic maps from projective lines to @xmath6",
    ". thus any element of @xmath373 consists of components that are affine gauged maps to @xmath6 , and components that stable maps to @xmath10 .",
    "we wish to compute the virtual push - forward under @xmath374 of @xmath375 on the families of affine gauged maps considered here , there is a lift of @xmath376 from the rigidified inertia stack @xmath320 to @xmath57 , and we may ignore the rigidification . consider the section @xmath377 consisting of the derivatives @xmath378 of @xmath351 at the marking @xmath379 ; note this is well - defined because of the scaling on the domain , that is , we are modding out by translation on the domain only . on the stratum @xmath380 , @xmath381 has zeroes corresponding to maps with all lower - order terms vanishing , and the restriction of @xmath376 to @xmath382 defines an isomorphism @xmath383 where @xmath384 is the sector with stabilizer @xmath367 , defined as the git quotient of the subspace of @xmath6 corresponding to coordinates @xmath385 with @xmath386 . the obstruction space at any morphism @xmath351 is the higher cohomology of the vector bundle @xmath387 , which may be identified via duality with the span of monomials whose @xmath368-th component has degree strictly between @xmath209 and @xmath388 .",
    "thus the obstruction bundle has euler class @xmath389 it follows that the contribution to the pushforward from the stratum with irreducible domain is @xmath390 as claimed .",
    "next we examine contributions from the boundary .",
    "any boundary configuration contains a component with a marking and a gauged map @xmath391 of class @xmath392 with @xmath393 together with other components that are morphisms to @xmath10 and affine gauged maps without markings .",
    "the zero set @xmath382 of @xmath381 on such a stratum has @xmath394 if @xmath395 , and so the components with non - zero leading order correspond to @xmath368 with @xmath396 .",
    "clearly , the convex hull of such weights can not contain @xmath82 , since @xmath397 by the description of the unstable locus in , the asymptotic limit of points in @xmath382 consist of unstable points in @xmath6 , and so the zero set is empty .",
    "finally we consider the integral @xmath398 } { { \\operatorname}{ev}}^ *   \\prod_{{\\langle}\\mu_j , d { \\rangle}\\ge 0 } \\mu_j^{\\lceil { \\langle}\\mu_j , d { \\rangle}\\rceil}\\ ] ] for @xmath399 .",
    "the same argument as in the previous paragraph shows that the integral is zero unless @xmath400 .",
    "but since @xmath82 is generic , this implies strict inequality and so these contributions are of higher energy .",

    "it would interesting to derive the formula for @xmath123 above directly from the geometric definition of the quantum kirwan map .",
    "motivated by considerations from mirror symmetry , givental @xcite and later hori - vafa @xcite , proposed a description of the quantum cohomology in terms of the _ jacobian ring _ of functions on the critical locus of a certain function , arising as the _ landau - ginzburg potential _ of the mirror sigma model .",
    "in particular , givental @xcite proved an isomorphism of the quantum cohomology of a smooth fano toric variety with the jacobian ring .",
    "( isomorphism of the batyrev ring with the jacobian ring of the naive potential ) [ ident ] @xmath502 \\mapsto [ q^{\\omega_j } y^{\\nu_j } ] , j = 1,\\ldots , k\\ ] ] is well - defined and induces an isomorphism .    without the novikov field ,",
    "the result is iritani @xcite : the linear relations among the weights for @xmath12 on @xmath6 correspond to the relations on the coordinate ring of @xmath194 given by the derivatives of the landau - ginzburg potential @xmath208 , since any such relation is of the form @xmath503 for some @xmath504 .",
    "furthermore the quantum stanley - reisner relations @xmath455 correspond to the relations on the various coordinates on the big dual torus @xmath505 restricted to @xmath194 : @xmath506 and both lines are equal since @xmath507 the proof extends over @xmath24 etc . by linearity of both sides over @xmath24 .    to compute the dimension of the jacobian ring we recall the following theorem of kouchnirenko s @xcite describing the number of critical points of a polynomial in several variables .",
    "let @xmath508 be a function given as a finite sum @xmath509 as @xmath510 ranges over the weights of @xmath194 , that is , coweights @xmath175 of @xmath172 .    1 .",
    "( newton polytope ) the convex polyhedron @xmath511 is the _",
    "newton polytope _ of @xmath4 .",
    "2 .   ( non - degeneracy at infinity )",
    "the function @xmath4 is _ non - degenerate at infinity _ if for any face @xmath512 , the _ face polynomial",
    "_ @xmath513 has no critical points . 3 .",
    "( multiplicity of a critical point ) by the _ multiplicity _ of an isolated critical point we mean the intersection multiplicity as in , for example , fulton s book ( * ? ? ? * lemma 12.1 ) . by @xcite",
    "the intersection is invariant under deformation in the sense that , given a family @xmath514 of functions depending smoothly on a parameter @xmath25 with isolated critical points , the sum of the multiplicities of critical points @xmath515 converging to @xmath516 is equal to the multiplicity of @xmath516 .",
    "( kouchnirenko theorem ) [ kouch ] suppose that @xmath4 is non - degenerate at infinity , @xmath517 generate @xmath175 , an @xmath518 generate @xmath175 .",
    "then the number @xmath519 of zeroes of @xmath520 counted with multiplicity is equal to @xmath521 the volume of the newton polytope ,",
    "@xmath522    we sketch the idea of proof , following the survey of atiyah @xcite .",
    "the critical locus @xmath3 with the set of intersection points of a sequence of hyperplanes with a generic torus orbit in the projectivization @xmath523 of the sum of weight spaces @xmath524 with non - zero coefficient @xmath525 .",
    "the non - degeneracy condition implies that all intersection points occur in the big torus orbit , so that @xmath519 equals the degree of the toric variety @xmath526 associated to @xmath527 .",
    "a standard computation shows that the duistermaat - heckman measure ( push - forward of the measure defined by the fubini - study form on @xmath526 to @xmath528 ) is the characteristic measure of the polytope @xmath527 .",
    "hence @xmath529    we apply kouchnirenko s theorem to the potential @xmath530 obtained by fixing a non - zero value of @xmath25 .",
    "let @xmath531 be the coordinate ring of @xmath532 . as noted in iritani @xcite , if we assume that @xmath209 is contained in the interior of the newton polytope of @xmath530 then @xmath530 is non - degenerate at infinity .",
    "( properties of the landau - ginzburg potential for fixed @xmath25 ) [ perturb ] [ finite ] if @xmath209 is contained in the interior of the moment polytope then    1 .",
    "@xmath533 is finite and independent of the choice of @xmath25 .",
    "2 .   the number @xmath534 of critical points of @xmath530 , counted with multiplicity is equal to @xmath521 times the volume of the dual polytope @xmath535 given as the convex hull of the normal vectors @xmath369 of facets of @xmath184 .",
    "@xmath230 is finite over @xmath251 $ ] .",
    "4 .   except for",
    "finitely many values of @xmath25 , the critical locus @xmath532 is smooth and @xmath531 is semisimple .",
    "( a)-(c ) are consequences of theorem [ kouch ] ; in particular the non - degeneracy at infinity implies that the morphism to @xmath251 $ ] is proper with finite fibers ( since the critical points can not run off to the boundary ) and so finite .",
    "( d ) follows from a computation of the jacobian of @xmath536 as in @xcite : if @xmath537 is a basis for @xmath538 then @xmath539 for @xmath540 positive real , that is , of the form @xmath541 .",
    "it follows that @xmath542)$ ] is generically smooth and so has generically reduced finite fibers .    as noted in iritani @xcite , @xcite ,",
    "kouchnirenko s theorem implies that    [ equal ] the order of @xmath532 is at least @xmath543 , with equality if and only if @xmath544 .",
    "kouchnirenko s theorem implies that the number of critical points is @xmath521 times the volume of the dual polytope , which is equal to the sum of the volumes of the maximal dimension cones of @xmath444 exactly if @xmath544 .",
    "because the dimensions of @xmath51 and @xmath232 do not match ( corollary [ equal ] , see figure [ dual ] ) there must be additional relations , that is , generators in the kernel of .",
    "several authors suggested , and iritani @xcite and fukaya et al @xcite proved in the case of toric manifolds , that the additional relations correspond to critical points outside of the moment polytope , and can be removed by using the formal version of the jacobian ring of the potential introduced in definition [ jac ] .",
    "( isomorphism of formal batyrev and jacobian rings ) [ batjac ] the map @xmath545 of proposition [ ident ] extends to an isomorphism @xmath546    it suffices to check that the degrees on both sides giving the filtration used to define completions on both sides agree .",
    "the degree of each weight @xmath547 is one , while the degree of its image @xmath548 in the grading of the jacobian ring given by is also one , by definition .",
    "[ same ] the following definitions are equivalent :    1 .",
    "( order of @xmath244 , algebraically ) the order of @xmath244 is equal to the number of points of @xmath230 counted with multiplicity whose closure contains @xmath245 via the embedding .",

    "since @xmath209 is assumed in the interior of the moment polytope , @xmath230 is flat and finite over @xmath251 $ ] , and @xmath244 is flat and finite over the formal punctured disk @xmath554 .",
    "the order of @xmath244 is the degree of the morphism , which is invariant under base change to @xmath555 , since both @xmath556 and @xmath24 are fields . on the other hand ,",
    "each irreducible components of @xmath244 are in bijection with the irreducible components of @xmath230 whose order of vanishing with respect to the divisors @xmath557 at @xmath167 is positive , see remark [ precise ] .",
    "the claim follows .",
    "we now explore the meaning of the positive part @xmath244 more geometrically , in terms of the moment map .",
    "( tropical moment map ) [ tropmom ] the _ tropical moment map _ is @xmath558    the following describes the special features of the restriction of the tropical moment map @xmath559 to the critical locus @xmath230 .",
    "( minimal facets ) given @xmath560 , a facet of @xmath184 defined by @xmath561 is _ minimal _ for @xmath562 iff it is among the `` closest '' among all facets , that is , @xmath563 we denote by @xmath564 the set of facets minimal for @xmath562 . more generally , for any subspace @xmath565 , we denote by @xmath566 the set of facets minimal for @xmath562 among those with @xmath567 .",
    "( uniqueness of minimal facets for generic points ) for a generic point @xmath560 , there will be a unique minimal facet ( the one `` closest '' to @xmath562 ) so @xmath564 will have order @xmath332 .",
    "each point @xmath562 on the boundary of @xmath184 has minimal facets @xmath564 equal to the set of facets of @xmath184 containing @xmath562 .",
    "the same holds in a neighborhood of the boundary , by continuity . for examples of points",
    "@xmath562 with more than @xmath568 minimal facets , see figure [ p1p1movie ] .",

    "[ closure ] any point in @xmath602 maps to the interior of the moment polytope @xmath184 under @xmath559 iff @xmath603 represents a point in @xmath244 , that is , contains @xmath604 in its closure .",

    "that the generic automorphism group is trivial , the image of @xmath244 in @xmath610 consists of moment values such that the corresponding lagrangian moment fiber is hamiltonian non - displaceable , see section [ discuss ] .",
    "in this section we show that the linearized quantum kirwan map is injective after passing to the formal completion and modding out by the quantum stanley - reisner ideal . by the surjectivity result in theorem [ weaktoric2 ] it suffices to show the equality of dimensions @xmath611 in the case that @xmath10 is fano and minimally presented as a quotient of @xmath6 by @xmath5 ( that is",
    ", every weight space in @xmath6 defines a prime divisor of @xmath10 ) this is a consequence of kouchnirenko s theorem , see corollary [ equal ] .    to reduce to the fano case",
    ", we apply the toric minimal model program introduced by reid @xcite .",
    "more precisely , we vary the khler class by a multiple of the canonical class until we obtain a fano fibration , showing that the wall - crossings on both sides of are the same .",
    "we wish to emphasize that , although we are using the language of toric minimal models , in fact all of our results are completely _ combinatorial _ , that is , could be phrased entirely in terms of fans . however , we find the geometric story accompanying the combinatorics rather helpful .",
    "first , recall the general phenomenon of wall - crossing in the context of geometric invariant theory quotients , as in thaddeus @xcite .",
    "( family of git quotients ) let @xmath612_{\\mathbb{q}}$ ] be an affine linear path of khler classes , corresponding to a path of rational polarizations ( ample @xmath5-line bundles ) @xmath613 .",
    "for any @xmath614_{\\mathbb{q}}$ ] let @xmath615 be the semistable locus , and assume that @xmath5 acts with finite stabilizers on @xmath616 for @xmath617 . then the same is true for generic @xmath614 $ ] and for such @xmath618 we denote by @xmath619 the stack - theoretic git quotient with respect to the corresponding polarization .",
    "the stack @xmath620 is a smooth proper deligne - mumford stack with projective coarse moduli space .",
    "( wall - crossing for git quotients ) [ with ] with @xmath621 as above .    1 .   ( walls )",
    "there exists a finite collection @xmath622 of _ singular values a.k.a walls _ such that there exist semistable points that are not stable ; 2 .",
    "[ chambers ] _ ( chambers ) _ the isomorphism class of the quotient @xmath623 is independent of @xmath618 for @xmath624 ; 3 .   _",
    "( wall - crossing ) _ suppose that stable = semistable for the @xmath5-action on @xmath625 .",
    "then as @xmath618 passes through a singular value , the quotient @xmath620 goes through a weighted blow - down and blow - up .    see figure [ mori ] for an example of the change in moment polytopes under such a variation ; the toric case is discussed further in @xcite , ( * ? ? ?",
    "* chapter 14 ) .",
    "[ weighted ] ( exceptional loci of weighted blow - downs ) a weighted blow - down is a morphism that is an isomorphism except over a single ( possibly stacky ) point where the fiber is the git quotient of a vector bundle by a circle action .",
    "thus if the point has trivial automorphism group then the fiber is a weighted projective space , but this is not true in general , see for example @xcite .",
    "first we discuss the invariance of the order of @xmath244 in each chamber .",
    "( critical points with values in a given interval ) for any interval @xmath626 , let @xmath627 denote the subset of the critical locus @xmath230 consisting of points @xmath603 with @xmath628 .",

    "( b ) we may suppose that @xmath658 are sufficiently close to the critical value @xmath705 so that there exists a number @xmath706 such that @xmath707 consists of a single value in @xmath708 , which crosses the boundary of @xmath709 as @xmath618 crosses @xmath705 , and the other components of @xmath710 stay outside of @xmath708 for all @xmath711 .",
    "the critical value that crosses the boundary corresponds to the intersection of @xmath712-hyperplanes varying linearly in @xmath618 , and so for each @xmath713 corresponds to a non - degenerate family of critical points by the formal criterion for smoothness . by kouchnirenko s theorem [ kouch ]",
    "the order of these critical points is @xmath714 . by this fact and proposition [ kouch ] the difference in the number of critical points of the potential before and",

    "( termination of a toric minimal model program ) in particular , one sees from the above wall - crossing formula that @xmath716 decreases at each wall - crossing .",
    "this is one of the proofs of the eventual termination of the toric minimal model program , discussed in @xcite , @xcite , where @xmath717 is described in combinatorial terms .",
    "( dependence of the jacobian ring on the symplectic class ) the location of the critical points also varies with the choice of symplectic class @xmath82 , and at certain affine linear hyperplanes ( occurring when more than @xmath718 normal vectors have a common value ) the critical points can `` collide '' and become degenerate .",
    "we call these additional hyperplanes `` miniwalls '' .",
    "if @xmath170 is monotone then the case that @xmath82 is anticanonical is called the _ monotone case _ and always occurs on ( possibly several ) miniwalls . in the example in figure [ 3chambers ]",
    ", there is a unique miniwall , corresponding to the anticanonical class , shown as a dotted line .",

    ", the linearization @xmath122 of the quantum kirwan map descends to a map @xmath767 defined in a formal neighborhood of the symplectic class @xmath768 . by theorem [ weaktoric2 ]",
    ", @xmath769 is surjective . by theorem [ equality ] , the induced map from @xmath770 to @xmath771 is an isomorphism in a formal neighborhood of @xmath468 .",
    "theorem [ main0 ] follows from the identification with the jacobian ring in proposition [ ident ] .",
    "the quantum cohomology of any proper toric orbifold with projective coarse moduli space is semisimple for generic symplectic classes @xmath772 .    as explained in (",
    "* proposition 4.9 ) , this follows from the identification with the batyrev ring , or rather , the jacobian ring of the superpotential and the fact proved in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 3.10 ) that for generic values , the superpotential has only non - degenerate critical values , part ( b ) of lemma [ perturb ] .    1 .",
    "( dubrovin conjecture for toric orbifolds ) the existence of a batyrev presentation implies that the quantum cohomology of @xmath0 is generically semisimple .",
    "this is related by a conjecture of dubrovin , see @xcite , to the existence of a full exceptional collection in the derived category of @xmath0 proved by kawamata @xcite , also using tmmps .",
    "2 .   ( non - semisimple cases ) for an example of a non - generic symplectic structure that gives non semi - simple quantum cohomology see ostrover - tyomkin @xcite .",
    "( equivariant first chern class maps to the potential ) under the isomorphism @xmath773 , the first chern class @xmath435 maps to the potential @xmath208 itself , by definition of the isomorphism .",
    "however , @xmath435 does not map to @xmath774 in general , as one can see from the example of @xmath58 acting on @xmath59 with weight two , where @xmath775 and @xmath435 maps to the twisted sector in @xmath10 .    as a corollary to the second part of the remark and the discussion above we have the following , which `` quantifies '' the sense in which flips in the minimal model program",
    "`` make the variety more fano '' .",
    "( decrease in the eigenvalues of @xmath776 under mmp flips ) suppose that @xmath620 undergoes a flip at @xmath777 .",
    "then the minimal @xmath25-valuation of the eigenvalues of quantum multiplication by @xmath778 on @xmath353 increases .    indeed , the critical value(s ) of @xmath208 moving outside the moment polytope at the time of the flip , are those with lowest @xmath25 valuation .",
    "( invariance of quantum cohomology under weighted toric flops ) one can also study the effect of toric flops on the quantum cohomology .",
    "suppose that @xmath620 is a family of toric quotients as above ( not necessarily in the direction of the canonical class ) so that @xmath620 is a locally free quotient for @xmath618 generic .",
    "we say that @xmath620 undergoes a _ flop _ at a singular time @xmath705 if there is a unique point @xmath779 semistable for @xmath705 with positive - dimensional stabilizer @xmath780 , the group @xmath780 is one - dimensional and the sum of the weights for @xmath780 on @xmath781 is zero . by kempf s descent criterion , in this case the canonical bundle descends to the singular quotient @xmath782 and",
    "so the quotients @xmath783 on either side of the critical value are @xmath784-equivalent . since the canonical bundle is locally pulled back from a bundle on the singular locus of the @xmath782 , in a neighborhood of the flop the quotients @xmath782 are calabi - yau , that is , have trivial canonical bundle .",
    "we claim that the quantum cohomologies of @xmath783 are isomorphic as vector spaces , and the quantum products are related by analytic continuation .",
    "first we show that no critical values cross the boundary of the moment polytope at @xmath705 .",
    "we suppose that the facets meeting the singular moment value ( which we may assume maps to @xmath209 ) at time @xmath705 ( which we may assume equals @xmath209 ) are numbered @xmath785 . by the genericity assumption",
    "the critical values for each @xmath618 mapping to @xmath209 at @xmath786 are non - degenerate and so map under @xmath559 to a point @xmath787 such that @xmath788 are independent of @xmath789 , where the constants @xmath790 are determined by the direction of the variation of symplectic class . by local triviality of the canonical bundle , the divisor with coefficients @xmath790 is locally linearly equivalent to the divisor with coefficients @xmath791 , for any constant @xmath792 .",
    "thus for any @xmath793 there exists a solution @xmath794 such that @xmath795 is independent of @xmath789 .",
    "taking e.g. @xmath796 we obtain that all these constants vanish .",
    "but then the variation does not give a point in the interior of the moment polytope for either @xmath797 or @xmath798 .",
    "it follows that @xmath799 is independent of @xmath618 in a neighborhood of @xmath705 , so that @xmath800 are isomorphic as vector spaces .",
    "the products are related by analytic continuation by analytic dependence of the jacobian ideal on the symplectic class .",
    "this ends the remark .",
    "we now give a family version of theorem [ main ] , which has the same proof as theorem [ main ] but with slightly more complicated notation .",
    "consider the family of potentials denoted @xmath801 given by @xmath802 where @xmath803 are the @xmath185-components of the projection @xmath804 of @xmath321 onto @xmath805 .",
    "[ familymain ] for any rational symplectic class @xmath34 there is a canonical isomorphism @xmath806 for @xmath33 in a formal neighborhood of @xmath437 in @xmath51 .",
    "the proof is the same as that of theorem [ main ] : ( * ? ? ?",
    "* example 9.21 ) shows that differential operators corresponding to the quantum stanley - reisner relations annihilate the localized gauged potential at any point in @xmath86 , and so descend to relations in @xmath807 .",
    "since the dimension is independent of @xmath33 , the map @xmath808 is an isomorphism .",
    "the same approach should work for the product structure at any point in the frobenius manifold for @xmath10 , not just a formal neighborhood , but so far the quantum kirwan map is only formal and we lack the necessary convergence results to use it away from the origin .",
    "we remark that iritani @xcite has proved several results about convergence of gromov - witten invariants on toric varieties",
    ". it would be interesting to relate the map @xmath123 with the coordinate changes studied in barannikov @xcite .",
    "finally we give the equivariant version .    _",
    "( equivariant version of the batyrev presentation ) _ [ maineq ] there is a canonical isomorphism @xmath809 for @xmath33 in a formal neighborhood of any rational symplectic class @xmath810 .",
    "we have already shown in theorem [ main0 ] the non - equivariant version of the statement in corollary [ maineq ] , that is , setting the equivariant parameters for @xmath811 to zero . by equivariant formality",
    ", @xmath812 is a free @xmath813-module , and this implies that @xmath814 is a free @xmath815 module . since the same is true for the left - hand - side , it follows that the linearization of the equivariant quantum kirwan map map @xmath816 is also an isomorphism .",
    "this section is a discussion of how the results here combine with those of @xcite , @xcite on non - displaceable lagrangian tori .",
    "in particular we explain that toric orbifolds can have infinitely many non - displaceable tori because they can have infinitely many tmmps .",
    "recall the following from @xcite :    [ wodisk ] ( non - displaceable toric moment fibers via critical points of the givental potential ) let @xmath6 be a finite dimensional vector space with a linear action of a torus @xmath5 and polarization so that the git quotient @xmath10 is a proper toric deligne - mumford stack with projective coarse moduli space , moment map @xmath179 and moment polytope @xmath817 .",
    "let @xmath208 denote the naive potential and @xmath818 the tropical moment map .",
    "then for any @xmath819 , the inverse image @xmath820 is a non - displaceable lagrangian torus in @xmath10 .    by the results of the previous sections , we may understand the critical values @xmath821 in terms of the corresponding minimal model program : let @xmath0 be a smooth proper polarized toric deligne - mumford stack with projective coarse moduli space , and @xmath5 a torus acting on a vector space @xmath6 so that @xmath10 , equipped with its residual torus action , is isomorphic to @xmath0 .    1 .   ( toric minimal model program )",
    "the sequence of toric varieties @xmath822 obtained by moving the equivariant symplectic class in the direction of @xmath823 is a _ toric minimal model program _ ( tmmp ) for @xmath0 ( also called a _ running _ of the tmmp in the literature ) .",
    "2 .   ( transition times )",
    "the values @xmath824 of @xmath618 for which @xmath620 is singular ( that is , not a locally free quotient ) are the _ transition times _ for the tmmp .",
    "3 .   ( dimension jumps )",
    "let @xmath825 for @xmath695 sufficiently small so that @xmath826 .",
    "let @xmath827 denote the _ dimension jump _ at @xmath705 .",
    "4 .   ( singular moment values ) for simplicity , we assume that @xmath828 has a single singular point , mapping to the _ singular moment value _ @xmath829 5 .   ( fiber of the fano fibration )",
    "suppose furthermore that for @xmath618 just before @xmath830 , the quotient @xmath620 is a fibration over @xmath831 , with monotone fiber @xmath832 .      1 .",
    "( non - uniqueness of tmmps ) many presentations of @xmath10 as a git quotient will give the same toric mmp .",
    "however , toric orbifolds can have infinitely many toric mmps , corresponding to different realizations of @xmath10 as git quotients .",
    "this is because the `` fake facets '' can `` catch up '' to the `` true facets '' under the deformation @xmath634 .",
    "for example , taking the minimal presentation of @xmath833 as a git quotient @xmath834 yields a trivial toric mmp , but introducing a presentation as a quotient @xmath835 yields a toric mmp with a flip to an `` orbifold hirzebruch surface '' , which is similar to @xcite .",
    "see figure [ p135mmp ] .",
    "the computation abreu - borman - mcduff ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 4.1.4 ) show that in the manifold case there is a unique tmmp , since the fake facets never `` catch up '' .",
    "( induced tmmp for the fibration at the end of the tmmp ) [ induceditem ] any presentation of @xmath0 as a git quotient @xmath10 induces a presentation of the base @xmath836 of the final fibration as a git quotient , corresponding to the inequalities that are not defining inequalities for the monotone fiber @xmath836 , that is , the inequalities which become strict equalities for the final polytope @xmath837 . hence , any presentation of @xmath0 induces a tmmp for the base of the final fibration .",
    "( eigenspace decomposition for quantum multiplication by @xmath838 ) let @xmath839 and @xmath840 note that that this is not equal to @xmath841 , already for @xmath842 a stacky point . consider the decomposition of quantum cohomology into eigenspaces for quantum multiplication by @xmath843 : @xmath844    [ jump ] ( relationships between tmmps and quantum cohomology )",
    "let @xmath0 be a compact toric orbifold and @xmath845 be a generic toric mmp for @xmath0 obtained from a quotient presentation @xmath846 with transition times @xmath705 , dimension jumps @xmath847 and singular moment values @xmath848 ,",
    "@xmath849 .    1 .   the transition times",
    "@xmath850 of the tmmp are the @xmath25-valuations of the eigenvalues @xmath851 of quantum multiplication by @xmath843 .",
    "the dimension jumps @xmath852 of the tmmp at time @xmath850 are the dimensions of the corresponding eigenspaces , @xmath853 3 .   for each @xmath854 ,",
    "the inverse image @xmath855 of @xmath848 in @xmath0 is hamiltonian non - displaceable .",
    "the number of local systems making the lagrangian floer homology of @xmath855 non - vanishing , counted with multiplicity , is also equal to @xmath847 ; 4 .   for @xmath856 ,",
    "the factor @xmath857 further splits @xmath858 @xmath859 according to a splitting induced from a tmmp @xmath860 for the base @xmath861 and fiber @xmath862 with dimension jumps @xmath863 as in remark [ induced ] , and for each singular value @xmath864 in such a tmmp the inverse image in @xmath0 is hamiltonian non - displaceable , etc .",
    "suppose that @xmath845 is a minimal model program corresponding to a presentation of @xmath0 as a quotient of @xmath6 by @xmath5 . by the main result theorem [ main ] @xmath865 , and",
    "the latter admits a decomposition into components corresponding to critical points with fixed value of the tropical moment map from definition [ tropmom ] .",
    "quantum multiplication is given by multiplication by @xmath208 itself , hence ( a ) and ( b ) .",
    "by lemma [ cross ] , each summand has dimension that of the dimension jump in the given tmmp .",
    "( c ) is theorem [ wodisk ] , with the multiplicity computed using kouchnirenko s theorem .",
    "( d ) is a consequence of lemma [ fibration ] .",
    "the results above are for generic initial symplectic class only .",
    "abreu has pointed out to us that there is still a connection between non - displaceable lagrangians and minimal model programs , even in the case that minimal model program involves flips over `` singular '' toric orbifolds , in the sense that the critical points of the landau - ginzburg potential for the singular toric manifolds `` cause '' non - displaceable moment fibers in the original manifold or orbifold .",
    "more precisely , we suppose that we are in the following situation :    1 .",
    "( singular base of a tmmp transition ) let @xmath0 be a compact toric orbifold with symplectic class @xmath866 and @xmath845 be a toric mmp for @xmath0 with dimension jumps @xmath847 and singular moment values @xmath848 , @xmath849 , and the flip / contraction at time @xmath705 has base a possibly singular toric variety @xmath867 with polytope @xmath868 .",
    "( normal part of the potential ) let @xmath869 denote the part of the potential @xmath208 corresponding to the normal vectors constant on @xmath867 , so that @xmath870 where @xmath871 is the sum of terms corresponding to vector @xmath369 that are _ non_-constant on @xmath867 .",
    "3 .   ( normally non - degenerate ) we say that the critical points mapping to @xmath868 under the tropical moment map are _ normally non - degenerate _ if each critical point of @xmath872 is non - degenerate .",
    "[ crit ] ( non - displaceable lagrangians via degenerate tmmps ) suppose that @xmath876 are as above so that every critical point occurring in each @xmath868 is normally non - degenerate .",
    "then each critical point @xmath608 of @xmath872 is equivalent , modulo terms vanishing on @xmath877 , to a critical point @xmath603 of @xmath208 , and so @xmath878 defines a non - displaceable moment fiber in @xmath0 .",
    "this is an consequence of the implicit function theorem of fukaya et al ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 10.4 ) for leading order critical points , or working with integer coefficients , the formal criterion for smoothness .",
    "indeed , any lift of a critical point @xmath879 has the property that @xmath880 descends to @xmath881 , since the partial derivatives in the direction of @xmath882 vanish .",
    "choose the unique lift @xmath603 such that the leading order terms @xmath883 in the partial derivatives along @xmath884 vanish .",
    "as in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 10.4 ) , the point @xmath603 may be corrected by a function on @xmath881 to a critical point of the full potential .        1 .",
    "( m. abreu ) suppose that @xmath0 is the toric manifold with vertices @xmath885 , which is a blow - up of a product @xmath593 ; this was the first example , discovered in fukaya - oh - ohta - ono @xcite , of a toric manifold with a continuum of non - displaceable toric fibers . the minimal model program for this symplectic class",
    "has no flips , and the final step is a `` singular fibration '' over a @xmath886 , with a single singular fiber consisting of a nodal @xmath886 .",
    "the critical points of the potential @xmath887 for this base , allowing various bulk deformations , consist of the line segment connecting @xmath888 with @xmath284 .",
    "the potential for the @xmath886 fiber has non - critical points , so these critical points are transversally non - degenerate and by theorem [ crit ] have values @xmath889 that define non - displaceable toric moment fibers , reproducing the result in this case from @xcite .",
    "see figure [ abreu1 ] .",
    "( m. abreu ) if @xmath0 is non - compact , a minimal model program for @xmath0 may have no transitions .",
    "for example , suppose that @xmath0 is the total space of @xmath890 , and the moment polytope of @xmath0 is given by the inequalities @xmath891 for @xmath892 , the resulting minimal model program corresponds to translation of the moment polytope , while for @xmath893 , the minimal model program corresponds to translation of the polytope together with a dilation by a constant greater than @xmath332 .",
    "see figure [ abreu2 ] .          1 .",
    "( algebra splittings ) the proof shows that @xmath894 is isomorphic to a factor in @xmath895 as an abstract vector space , as a @xmath24-module after analytic continuation corresponding to the deformation from @xmath896 to @xmath897 .",
    "the factors @xmath898 are canonically isomorphic to the quantum cohomology algebras @xmath899 where @xmath867 is the toric orbifold whose fan is the flipping simplex @xmath900 of definition [ flip ] , and @xmath901 is a monotone symplectic form on @xmath867 with barycenter the unique critical value that moved outside the polytope , as an abstract vector space and as a @xmath24-module after analytic continuation .",
    "these are the polytopes shown as dotted lines in figure [ 3chambers ] .",
    "( mirror results ) similar results with the role of the @xmath902-model and @xmath903-model switched ( that is , the derived category of the toric orbifold and the fukaya - seidel category of the landau - ginzburg model ) are discussed in kerr @xcite .",
    "3 .   ( open subsets of non - displaceable fibers )",
    "the existence of an open subset of non - displaceable toric fibers in @xcite can also be interpreted in terms of the tmmps .",
    "the discussion of @xmath833 in example [ induced ] shows that tmmps can come in multi - parameter families , with as many parameters as the dimension of the toric orbifolds , causing open subsets of non - displaceable toric moment fibers .",
    "4 .   ( conjecture on the relationship between minimal model programs and non - displaceable lagrangians in non - toric cases )",
    "it would be interesting to know whether a decomposition of quantum cohomology and collections of non - displaceable lagrangians can be associated to minimal model programs in general . in particular , we conjecture that the number of hamiltonian non - displaceable lagrangians in a khler manifold is at least as great as the number of transitions ( flips , divisorial contractions , or fano fibrations ) in any minimal model program such that each fibration has fano fibers .",
    "a.  givental . a mirror theorem for toric complete intersections . in _",
    "topological field theory , primitive forms and related topics ( kyoto , 1996 ) _ , volume 160 of _ progr .",
    "_ , pages 141175 .",
    "birkhuser boston , boston , ma , 1998 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be a compact toric orbifold ( smooth proper deligne - mumford toric stack ) with projective coarse moduli space and @xmath1 its orbifold quantum cohomology . </S>",
    "<S> we construct a canonical isomorphism from a formal completion of the batyrev ring from @xcite to @xmath1 in a formal neighborhood of a canonical bulk deformation . </S>",
    "<S> this isomorphism generalizes results of givental @xcite , iritani @xcite and fukaya - oh - ohta - ono @xcite for toric manifolds and coates - lee - corti - tseng @xcite for weighted projective spaces . from the point of view of mirror symmetry , </S>",
    "<S> the formal batyrev ring is the the ring of functions on the subset @xmath2 of the critical locus @xmath3 of the givental potential @xmath4 consisting of critical points mapping to the interior of the moment polytope , as in @xcite , @xcite , @xcite in the manifold case .    </S>",
    "<S> the proof uses algebro - geometric virtual fundamental classes , a quantum version of kirwan surjectivity , and an equality of dimensions deduced using a toric minimal model program ( tmmp ) . as a corollary </S>",
    "<S> , we show that any tmmp for @xmath0 with generic symplectic class defines a correspondence between ( i ) eigenspaces for quantum multiplication by the first chern class ( ii ) transitions ( flips , contractions or fibration ) in the tmmp , and ( iii ) hamiltonian non - displaceable lagrangian tori . </S>",
    "<S> in particular the valuations of the eigenvalues of quantum multiplication by the first chern class are the transition times in the tmmp and the existence of infinitely many tmmps can produce open families of hamiltonian non - displaceable lagrangians , such as in the examples in wilson - woodward @xcite .        </S>",
    "<S> .1 in </S>"
  ]
}
